list_definition.definition: to ask God to show favour to

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Bless this ship and all who sail in her.

list_ex_of_english: When this was over, the head lama blessed all the monks.
We are already blessed with one or two excellent bodies.
I hope they will be abundantly blessed in all that they do.
Both developments were auspiciously blessed in the 1990s by the good fortune of economic stability, but now face the less favourable climate of the early 2000s.
He looked forward to ' ' a new world blessed with plenty, purified with justice, and sweetened with brotherly kindness.
My constituency is blessed with excellent maintained schools, and the pupils are intensely proud of them and of their teachers.
I trust that you may be blessed with good health during your period of office, to carry out the great task imposed upon you.
Of course, we all know that blessed word "appropriate".
